course.description_en: Meet our furry and feathered friends who live with us at home. Learn how to care for pets and be their best friend.
course.description_ar: تعرف على أصدقائنا من الحيوانات الأليفة الذين يعيشون معنا في المنزل. تعلم كيفية الاعتناء بالحيوانات الأليفة وكن أفضل صديق لهم.
course.subject: science

content_data.title: Fluffy's Day at Home
content_data.content: This is Fluffy the cat. Fluffy lives with Emma's family. Fluffy is soft and orange. Fluffy says MEOW! Fluffy likes to sleep on Emma's bed. Fluffy sleeps a lot during the day. At night, Fluffy likes to play. Fluffy plays with a red ball. Fluffy rolls the ball with her paws. Fluffy also likes to climb. She climbs on chairs and tables. Fluffy drinks water from her special bowl. She eats cat food every day. Emma pets Fluffy gently. Fluffy purrs when she is happy. PURR PURR PURR! That means Fluffy loves Emma. Cats are wonderful pets who need love and care.

vocabulary_words.definition: Soft pet animal that says meow

content_data.parent_guidance: Show gentle petting motions. Practice making 'meow' and 'purr' sounds together. Emphasize being gentle with pets. If you have a cat, let child observe from safe distance.
safety_notes: Always be gentle with real cats
Never pull cat's tail or ears
Let cats come to you first
Adult supervision around all pets
discussion_questions: What sound does Fluffy make?
How should we touch a cat?
What does purring mean?

extension_activities.title: Cat Walk
extension_activities.description: Walk on hands and knees like a cat. Practice being quiet and gentle.

extension_activities.title: Cat Care Play
extension_activities.description: Pretend to feed and pet a stuffed cat gently.

content_data.title: Buddy's Happy Day
content_data.content: This is Buddy the dog. Buddy lives with Sam's family. Buddy is brown and white. Buddy says WOOF WOOF! Buddy has a long tail. When Buddy is happy, his tail wags back and forth. Wag wag wag! Buddy loves to play fetch. Sam throws a stick. Buddy runs fast to get it. Buddy brings the stick back to Sam. Good dog, Buddy! Buddy likes to walk outside. He wears a collar and leash. Sam holds the leash to keep Buddy safe. Buddy drinks water from his bowl. He eats dog food twice a day. At night, Buddy sleeps in his bed. Buddy loves his family very much. Dogs are loyal friends who need exercise and love.
learning_objectives: Understand dogs need exercise and care

vocabulary_words.definition: Long part that wags when happy
Game where dog brings things back
Rope to keep dog safe on walks

materials_needed: Small stick or toy to throw
content_data.parent_guidance: Practice tail wagging motions. Show how to throw and retrieve gently. Explain why dogs need leashes for safety. Make 'woof' sounds together.
safety_notes: Never approach unknown dogs
Ask before petting someone else's dog
Be gentle and calm around dogs
Adult supervision always required
discussion_questions: What does Buddy's tail do when he's happy?
Why does Buddy wear a leash?
What game does Buddy like to play?

extension_activities.title: Fetch Game
extension_activities.description: Practice throwing and bringing back a soft toy gently.

extension_activities.title: Tail Wagging Dance
extension_activities.description: Wiggle your bottom like a happy dog's tail.

content_data.title: Sunny Sings a Song
content_data.content: This is Sunny the bird. Sunny lives in a nice cage. Sunny is yellow like the sun. Sunny says TWEET TWEET! Sunny likes to sing beautiful songs. Tweet tweet tweet! Sunny has pretty feathers. Sunny's feathers are soft and colorful. Sunny likes to eat seeds. She also drinks fresh water every day. Sunny's cage has a swing. Sunny likes to swing back and forth. Sunny also has a mirror. She looks at herself and says tweet! Maya talks to Sunny every day. Maya says 'Hello Sunny!' Sunny learns to say some words too. Birds are smart pets who like to sing and talk.
learning_objectives: Understand birds live in cages safely

vocabulary_words.definition: Pet with feathers that can sing

content_data.parent_guidance: Practice bird sounds and singing together. Show gentle movements like bird swinging. Explain why pet birds need cages for safety. Let child look in mirror and 'talk' to themselves.
safety_notes: Never stick fingers in bird cages
Birds can bite if scared
Adult handles all bird care
Supervise mirror use
discussion_questions: What color is Sunny?
What does Sunny like to eat?
How does Sunny make music?

extension_activities.title: Bird Song Time
extension_activities.description: Make up simple songs and sing like Sunny.

extension_activities.title: Feather Art
extension_activities.description: Glue yellow paper pieces to make bird feathers.

content_data.title: Swimming Like Goldie
content_data.content: Goldie is a goldfish. Goldie lives in a round bowl with clean water. Goldie is orange and shiny. Goldie does not make sounds. Fish are quiet pets. Goldie swims all day long. She swims up and down. She swims round and round. Goldie has fins to help her swim. Let's pretend to be Goldie! Move your arms like fins. Swim around the room quietly. Goldie eats tiny fish food every day. She blows bubbles in the water. Bubble bubble bubble! Let's pretend to blow bubbles too!
learning_objectives: Learn about fish as quiet pets
content_data.parent_guidance: Guide swimming motions safely. Show arm movements like fins. Practice quiet movements. If using bubbles, supervise closely and ensure child doesn't drink bubble solution.
safety_notes: No real water play without supervision
Never put fingers in fish bowls
Adult supervision for all bubble activities
Clear space for safe movement
discussion_questions: How does Goldie move in the water?
What does Goldie use to swim?
Do fish make sounds like cats and dogs?

extension_activities.title: Fish Swimming Dance
extension_activities.description: Move arms and body like swimming fish.

extension_activities.title: Fish Bowl Art
extension_activities.description: Draw a fish in a round bowl shape.

content_data.title: Nibbles Loves to Hop
content_data.content: This is Nibbles the rabbit. Nibbles lives with Lily's family. Nibbles is white and fluffy. Rabbits do not bark or meow. But Nibbles makes a soft sound. She goes THUMP THUMP with her back feet. Nibbles has long ears. She can hear very well. Nibbles has a pink nose that wiggles. Wiggle wiggle wiggle! Nibbles loves to hop. Hop hop hop around the yard! Nibbles eats carrots and lettuce. She nibbles her food with her front teeth. Nibbles likes to hide in boxes. She feels safe in small spaces. Lily gives Nibbles fresh water every day. Rabbits are gentle pets who love to hop and play.
learning_objectives: Know rabbits hop and thump feet
content_data.parent_guidance: Practice hopping movements safely. Show nose wiggling and ear movements. Let child explore hiding in box if safe size. Practice gentle nibbling motions.
safety_notes: Hop in safe, clear area only
Check box size is safe for child
Adult supervision for all activities
No real carrots for choking prevention
discussion_questions: How does Nibbles move around?
What does Nibbles like to eat?
Where does Nibbles like to hide?

extension_activities.title: Bunny Hop Game
extension_activities.description: Practice hopping like Nibbles around the room.

extension_activities.title: Carrot Feeding Game
extension_activities.description: Pretend to feed paper carrot to stuffed rabbit.

content_data.title: How to Care for Our Pet Friends
content_data.content: Pets need our help every day. Let's learn how to care for them! First, pets need fresh water. Fill their water bowl every day. Next, pets need the right food. Cats eat cat food. Dogs eat dog food. Birds eat seeds. Fish eat fish food. Never give pets people food. Pets need a clean home. Clean their beds and toys. Wash their food bowls. Pets need exercise and play. Walk dogs outside. Play with cats using toys. Let birds swing in their cage. Pets need love and gentle touches. Pet them softly. Talk to them nicely. When pets are sick, they need a doctor called a vet. The vet helps pets feel better.
learning_objectives: Understand pets need food, water, and love

vocabulary_words.definition: Job to take care of something

content_data.parent_guidance: Guide through each care step slowly. Let child practice with stuffed animals. Emphasize gentle touching and responsibility. Explain when adults handle real pet care.
safety_notes: Adult supervision for all real pet care
Use only pretend food for activity
Ensure stuffed animals are clean
Practice gentle touches only
discussion_questions: What do pets need every day?
How should we touch our pets?
Who helps pets when they are sick?

extension_activities.title: Pet Hospital Play
extension_activities.description: Pretend to be a vet checking stuffed animals.

extension_activities.title: Pet Care Schedule
extension_activities.description: Make a simple picture chart of pet care tasks.

content_data.title: What Sound Do I Make?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun game about our pet friends! I will tell you about a pet. You tell me what sound it makes or how it moves!
materials_needed: Pictures of pets from previous lessons
content_data.parent_guidance: Ask questions slowly and give hints if needed. Celebrate every answer. Make the sounds together. Keep it playful and encouraging.
safety_notes: No safety concerns
Keep session positive and fun
discussion_questions: I am soft and orange. I say this sound when I talk. What do I say?
I wag my tail when happy. I like to play fetch. What sound do I make?
I am yellow and live in a cage. I like to sing. What sound do I make?
I swim in water and blow bubbles. Do I make sounds?
I am fluffy with long ears. I move by doing this. How do I move?
When pets are sick, who helps them feel better?

extension_activities.title: Pet Sound Orchestra
extension_activities.description: Make all the pet sounds together in a fun song.

extension_activities.title: Guess My Pet
extension_activities.description: Parent acts like a pet, child guesses which one.

content_data.title: Celebrating All Our Pet Friends
content_data.content: Let's have a special parade for all our pet friends! First, be Fluffy the cat. Walk quietly and say MEOW. Stretch like a cat waking up. Next, be Buddy the dog. Wag your tail and say WOOF. Play fetch with an imaginary stick. Then, be Sunny the bird. Flap your arms like wings and say TWEET. Sing a pretty song. Now, be Goldie the fish. Move your arms like fins and swim silently around. Finally, be Nibbles the rabbit. Hop hop hop and wiggle your nose. Great job! You know all about pet friends. Remember to always be gentle and kind to pets. They need our love and care every day.
learning_objectives: Review all pets learned in course
Practice all pet movements and sounds
materials_needed: Optional: pictures of all pets as reminders
content_data.parent_guidance: Join the parade! Take turns being different pets. Encourage child to remember movements and sounds. Make it celebratory and fun. Reinforce gentle pet care message.
safety_notes: Clear area of obstacles for safe movement
Use soft movements only
Take breaks if child gets tired
Keep all movements gentle
discussion_questions: Which pet was your favorite to pretend to be?
What do all pets need from us?
How should we always treat pets?

extension_activities.title: Pet Family Drawing
extension_activities.description: Draw all the pets we learned about together.

extension_activities.title: Pet Care Promise
extension_activities.description: Make a promise to always be gentle with pets.
